title: Into the Wild
author: Jon Krakauer
description: Into the Wild is the true story of Chris McCandless, a young Emory graduate who is found dead in the Alaskan wilderness in September 1992

title: Wild: From Lost to Found on the Pacific Crest Trail
author: Cheryl Strayed
description: This memoir follows the author's journey as she hikes the Pacific Crest Trail alone, reflecting on her past and finding herself along the way.

title: Unbroken: A World War II Story of Survival, Resilience, and Redemption
author: Laura Hillenbrand
description: This book tells the extraordinary true story of Louis Zamperini, an Olympic athlete and WWII bombardier who survives a plane crash, being lost at sea, and enduring brutal treatment as a prisoner of war.

title: The Lost City of Z: A Tale of Deadly Obsession in the Amazon
author: David Grann
description: This book explores the true story of British explorer Percy Fawcett and his quest to find a lost ancient city in the Amazon rainforest, which ultimately leads to his mysterious disappearance.

title: The Lost City of Z: A Tale of Deadly Obsession in the Amazon
author: David Grann
description: This book explores the true story of British explorer Percy Fawcett and his quest to find a lost ancient city in the Amazon rainforest, which ultimately leads to his mysterious disappearance.

title: Endurance: Shackleton's Incredible Voyage
author: Alfred Lansing
description: This gripping account narrates the true story of Ernest Shackleton and his crew's ill-fated expedition to Antarctica, highlighting their incredible journey of survival and endurance.

title: Into Thin Air: A Personal Account of the Mount Everest Disaster
author: Jon Krakauer
description: In this gripping firsthand account, the author shares his experience as a member of a climbing expedition on Mount Everest, which turned into one of the deadliest disasters in the mountain's history.
